title: Kling 3.0 vs Sora 2 Pro: The 2026 Video Wars
summary: The landscape of AI video has shifted. Kling 3.0 now offers full cinematic control with its 'Director Mode,' while Sora 2 Pro has introduced 'Temporal Lock' for perfect consistency across 60-second shots. Seedance 1.5 Pro is emerging as the dark horse for high-speed creative workflows.

title: Claude Code: New 'Plan Mode' Redefines Autonomy
summary: Anthropic has officially launched 'Plan Mode' for Claude Code. The agent can now draft multi-file architectural changes and simulate their impact before writing a single line of code, significantly reducing hallucination in complex software projects.

title: Agent Zero: The OS for AI Agents reaches v2.5
summary: Agent Zero has become the standard for general-purpose computer assistants. Its new 'Sub-Agent Swarm' allows a single instance to delegate thousands of micro-tasks across a virtual Linux cluster, making it the most powerful open-source agentic framework available.

title: Suno vs Udio: The 2026 Music Generation Benchmark
summary: Suno v4 has introduced 'Multi-Track Separation' directly in the generation phase, while Udio 2.0 has focused on 'Pro-Vocal' fidelity that is now indistinguishable from studio recordings. Both models have added MIDI export capabilities for professional producers.

title: Our First Proof submissions
summary: We share our AI model’s proof attempts for the First Proof math challenge, testing research-grade reasoning on expert-level problems.

title: Advancing independent research on AI alignment
summary: OpenAI commits $7.5M to The Alignment Project to fund independent AI alignment research, strengthening global efforts to address AGI safety and security risks.

title: Introducing OpenAI for India
summary: OpenAI for India expands AI access across the country—building local infrastructure, powering enterprises, and advancing workforce skills.

title: Introducing EVMbench
summary: OpenAI and Paradigm introduce EVMbench, a benchmark evaluating AI agents’ ability to detect, patch, and exploit high-severity smart contract vulnerabilities.

summary: a stylized design resembling the Ashoka Chakra with colorful network lines and text reading "भारत 2026 INDIA." A vertical line separates it from the Google logo on the right, all set against a light blue gradient background with a faint grid pattern.

title: Seedance 2.0 might be gen AI video’s next big hope, but it’s still slop
summary: When Irish filmmaker Ruairi Robinson began uploading a series of short clips created with Seedance 2.0 - TikTok developer ByteDance's newest video generation model - it was hard to deny that the footage was much more impressive than what we've seen from other gen AI outfits. The clips' star (a digital duplicate of Tom Cruise) […]

title: Suspect in Tumbler Ridge school shooting described violent scenarios to ChatGPT
summary: The suspect in the mass shooting at Tumbler Ridge, British Columbia, Jesse Van Rootselaar, was raising alarms among employees at OpenAI months before the shooting took place. This past June, Jesse had conversations with ChatGPT involving descriptions of gun violence that triggered the chatbot's automated review system. Several employees raised concerns that her posts could […]

title: Google adds a way to create automated workflows to Opal
summary: Google is adding a new feature to Opal to create automated workflows

title: Anthropic launches new push for enterprise agents with plug-ins for finance, engineering, and design
summary: It's a major opportunity to grow Anthropic’s enterprise client base — and a significant threat to SaaS products currently performing those functions.

title: New Relic launches new AI agent platform and OpenTelemetry tools
summary: New Relic is giving enterprises more observability tools, letting them create and manage AI agents, and better integrate OTel data streams.
